metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0433 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel's BPFsubsystem in the way a user triggers the map_get_next_key function of theBPF bloom filter. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system. Thisflaw affects Linux kernel versions prior to 5.17-rc1.

criterions.comment: linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
